content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: Try moving your account again following the instructions at https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer.
creator: siffemoz

content:
How did you do the copy? These are recommended steps: You did not explain how you copied. If you used thunderbird's zip export, it REMOVES passwords. A better approach might be this:

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there

I don't know because I don't use POP accounts, but it sounds as if you have a POP account and you have checked options to leave messages on the server until you delete them.

If you have a POP account and you access your mail from more than one device, you may want to leave those settings as they are and just add a step of deleting when move messages.

If you don't need to leave messages on the server, then you can disable those options through webmail. I don't know if there is a way to do it in Thunberbird.

creator: wsmwk

content:
Se il problema si è verificato subito dopo l'importazione, potresti dover aspettare un po' per consentire a Thunderbird di indicizzare la posta (specie se il tuo archivio è molto grande).

Se invece è passato già del tempo, allora potrebbe essere necessario fare manutenzione al database ed agli indici di Thunderbird:

  1. Fare un backup integrale del profilo -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/profili-thunderbird#w_effettuare-una-copia-di-sicurezza-del-profilo
  2. Compattare le cartelle -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/compattazione-cartelle
  3. Riavviare Thunderbird
  4. Se il problema non è risolto, ricostruire l'indice globale -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricostruzione-indice-globale
  5. Riavviare Thunderbird
  6. Se il problema non si è ancora risolto: click destro sulla cartella che contiene la mail illeggibile -> Proprietà -> [Ripara la cartella]

Infine tieni conto che Thunderbird ha 2 strumenti di ricerca:

  • Il Filtro veloce funziona solo sulla cartella attiva in quel momento -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/barra-filtro-veloce
  • La Ricerca Globale cerca invece su tutto l'archivio -> https://support.mozilla.org/it/kb/ricerca-globale

content:
You did not explain how you copied. If you used thunderbird's zip export, it REMOVES passwords. A better approach might be this:

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there

Unfortunately, there is no simple answer. If the old computer is accessible you can start thunderbird, click settings>privacy&security and retrieve passwords there. Those may work unless you are using an account requiring Oauth2.
creator: davidsk

content:
Why is drag and drop not allowed? It works for me.

Googles AI tells me this about removing duplicates.

To remove duplicate emails in Thunderbird, you can use the "Remove Duplicate Messages" add-on. This add-on allows you to scan folders for duplicates and delete them. You can find and install it from the Thunderbird add-ons manager. Here's how to use the add-on: Open Thunderbird and go to the Add-ons manager. This can be found under the Tools menu. Search for "Remove Duplicate Messages" and install it. Restart Thunderbird. Right-click on the folder you want to check. Select "Remove Duplicate Messages". Follow the on-screen instructions to delete the duplicates. Additionally, you can configure the add-on by going to Tools > Add-on Options > Remove Duplicate Messages. This allows you to choose which characteristics to compare (like message ID, send time, subject, etc.) and choose whether to keep the first or last occurrence of a duplicate.

Looking at the addon mentioned it works with V128-139 (the current supported releases) so it sounds like good advice to me.
creator: MattAuSupport

content:
Hello there We have read the message. We try to help.



Can i assist you to Connect Yahoo mail to the Thunderbird mail?

First open Thunderbird and try to create a first account. Of do you have a account at Thunderbird.?oké. Then.

Open Yahoo mail and try to : Select tools and go to account settings. Go to the left site and select in the menu account action s try to choose for add mail account and click on that menu icon. Attach or add all of your e-mail passwords and name and e-mail Click on continu.

Go to Manuall configuration. After that you can choose for Imap or Pop.

Choose for IMAP If you like Imap.

(incoming server) Host name And Connect to port 993. Connecties security SSL/TLS Authentication method : Autodetect. Username ….

(For the outgoing server.)

Hostname Choose for port 465. Connection security. SSL / TLS Authentication method autodetect. Username …..

And push save. After that configuration and verification the Yahoo mail account will be added to the Thunderbird account.

content:
If you could supply the error messages that accompany these issues perhaps someone could guess, but the description you have so far could just as easily describe a visually impaired person walking into a fence. Something keeps stopping them walking forward, they have no idea what it is, but they know they can not go there.

(That person was my brother-in-law by the way. I am not making it up.)

I can say that certain antivirus products make a habit of preventing mail connections, so do some VPN's with some providers (many mail providers will guess you have been hacked if you use a VPN and raise a flag/alert instead of letting you in.) Others lock account for sending spam, or to many wrong passwords (that was a bug in the not so distant past where Thunderbird would retry a failed connection and the provider would disable the account)

But really I am just offering some suggestions off the top of my head because I have no specifics to work with, but by far the most likely cause of a failure to get mail after an upgrade/update will be your antivirus/ Software firewall.
creator: MattAuSupport

"If you add the account offline...all the settings...can be set in the Advanced config...before going online".

Re: "add the account offline": I don't believe an OAuth flow supports this. I am not finding the account auth can be completed while offline. The authentication flow simply does not proceed.

content: It works here with gmail accounts with OAuth2. Once all the settings are entered for the account, go back online, and when TB connects to the server (restart TB or select the Inbox), the OAuth window should appear and prompt for the account password.

content:
click on a message in the list to select it. press Ctrl+Shift+End to select everything from your point of selection to the end of the list or Ctrl+A to select everything in the list. Press Shift +Delete to delete and bypass the deleted mail folder, or press the delete key to move all of those mails to the deleted mail folder.

Note: Ctrl+Shift+End and Ctrl+A are windows shortcuts, they work in all windows applications that use a list.
